problem.prob_desc:
23. 5개의 문자 $x,\ x,\ y,\ y,\ z$를 모두 일렬로 나열하는 경우의 수는? [2점]
① 10 ② 20 ③ 30 ④ 40 ⑤ 50

gpt-5-codex.title: Identify counting approach
gpt-5-codex.body: The letters x, x, y, y, z form a multiset with repeated elements, so the number of distinct permutations is given by the permutation formula for multisets.

gpt-5-codex.title: Compute permutations
gpt-5-codex.body: Total permutations of five symbols ignoring repetition is 5! = 120. Divide by 2! for the two x’s and by another 2! for the two y’s: 120 / (2! × 2!) = 120 / 4 = 30.

gpt-5.title: Use multiset permutation formula
gpt-5.body: We are arranging 5 letters with repeats: x, x, y, y, z. The number of distinct permutations is 5! divided by the factorials of identical counts: 5! / (2!·2!).

gpt-5.title: Compute and choose option
gpt-5.body: Compute 5! = 120, and 2!·2! = 4, so 120 / 4 = 30. This matches option ③.

claude-opus-4.5.title: Identify the problem type
claude-opus-4.5.body:
We need to arrange 5 letters: x, x, y, y, z in a row. This is a permutation problem with repeated elements.
- Letter x appears 2 times
- Letter y appears 2 times
- Letter z appears 1 time
- Total: 5 letters

claude-opus-4.5.title: Apply permutation formula with repetition
claude-opus-4.5.body:
For n objects where there are n₁ identical objects of type 1, n₂ identical objects of type 2, etc., the number of arrangements is:

n! / (n₁! × n₂! × ...)

Here: 5! / (2! × 2! × 1!)

Calculation:
- 5! = 120
- 2! = 2
- 2! = 2
- 1! = 1

Number of arrangements = 120 / (2 × 2 × 1) = 120 / 4 = 30

gemini-3-pro.title: Identify total items and repeating characters
gemini-3-pro.body: There are a total of 5 characters to arrange: $x, x, y, y, z$. Among them, there are two identical $x$'s, two identical $y$'s, and one distinct $z$. The problem requires finding the number of distinct permutations of these items.

gemini-3-pro.title: Calculate using the permutation formula
gemini-3-pro.body:
Using the formula for permutations of a multiset $\frac{n!}{n_1! n_2! \cdots}$, where $n=5$ is the total number of items, and we divide by the factorials of the counts of identical items ($2!$ for $x$ and $2!$ for $y$):

$$ \frac{5!}{2! \times 2! \times 1!} = \frac{120}{2 \times 2 \times 1} = \frac{120}{4} = 30 $$

grok-4-fast.title: Identify permutation of multiset
grok-4-fast.body: The problem requires finding the number of distinct arrangements of five letters: two identical x's, two identical y's, and one z. This is a multiset permutation problem, where identical items reduce the total count.

grok-4-fast.title: Apply multiset permutation formula
grok-4-fast.body: The formula for distinct permutations is \(  rac{n!}{n_1! \cdot n_2! \cdot \ldots \cdot n_k!} \), where n=5 (total letters), n_x=2, n_y=2, n_z=1. Thus, \(  rac{5!}{2! \cdot 2! \cdot 1!} \).

grok-4-fast.title: Compute the value
grok-4-fast.body: Calculate 5! = 120. Then, 2! = 2, so denominator is 2 × 2 × 1 = 4. Finally, 120 / 4 = 30.
